page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The area lies almost 4 miles due north of York, between the villages of Shipton and Wigginton.It is a rural area. The land is mainly used for farming,a mixture of arable and stock.The land is low-lying,with no raised ground. Several ditches cross the area. Some have been dug out and widened, for drainage.Most are very overgrown,with shrubs and small trees filling them.Much of the area was very wet underfoot, the result of heavy rainfall during the summer. Area is divided into thirds by two roads running south-east to north-west,the B1363 from York to Helmsley, and a country road from Skelton which eventually peters out into an untarred road north of the area, into a district koown as Bohemia.Electricity pylons cross the area.
